mainBoard.name: Control Magic
mainBoard.originalText: You control target creature until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target creature is already tapped it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target creature is put in its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Crimson Manticores can be fearsome allies. As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

foreignData.name: Feuerball
foreignData.text: Der Feuerball verursacht insgesamt X Schaden. Dieser wird gleichmäßig (abgerundet) über Zielkreaturen und/oder Spieler verteilt. Bezahle zusätzlich 1 für jedes Ziel mit Ausnahme des ersten.

mainBoard.name: Fireball
mainBoard.originalText: Fireball does X damage total, divided evenly (round down) among any number of targets. Pay 1 extra mana for each target beyond the first.

rulings.text: Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.

For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its mana value is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.

mainBoard.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

mainBoard.name: Fungusaur
mainBoard.originalText: At the end of any turn during which Fungusaur was damaged but not destroyed, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

mainBoard.text: Whenever this creature is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

mainBoard.name: Regeneration
mainBoard.originalText: {G} Target creature regenerates.
mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, instead tap it, remove it from combat, and heal all damage on it.)

foreignData.name: Lockruf der Sirenen
foreignData.text: Sämtliche Kreaturen des Gegners, die angreifen könnten, müssen angreifen. Alle Kreaturen, die es nicht tun und keine Mauern sind, werden am Ende der Spielrunde vernichtet. Dieser Spontanzauber kann nur gespielt werden, wenn der Gegner am Ende des Zuges ist, und nur vor seiner Angriffsphase. Kreaturen, die während dieser Runde heraufbeschworen wurden, bleiben vom Lockruf der Sirenen verschont.

mainBoard.name: Siren's Call
mainBoard.originalText: All of opponent's creatures that can attack must do so. Any non-wall creatures that cannot attack are killed at end of turn. Can be played only during opponent's turn, before opponent's attack. Creatures summoned this turn are unaffected by Siren's Call.

rulings.text: It will require creatures with Haste to attack since they are able, but it won’t destroy them if they don’t for some reason.
The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can’t do so legally.
This will destroy creatures that weren’t able to attack because they had been previously tapped.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can only be cast before the beginning of the Declare Attackers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

mainBoard.text:
Cast this spell only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.
Creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able.
At the beginning of the next end step, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.
mainBoard.name: Timber Wolves
mainBoard.originalText: Bands

rulings.text: A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.

If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it.

mainBoard.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

mainBoard.name: Unstable Mutation
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature gains +3/+3. Each round, put a -1/-1 counter on the creature during its controller's upkeep. These counters remain even if this enchantment is removed before the creature dies.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters stay even if the Aura is removed, and the +3/+3 goes away when the Aura does.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

foreignData.text: 0: Ziehe eine Karte, wenn Du eine Verzauberung erfolgreich gesprochen hast. Du kannst diesen Effekt allerdings pro Verzauberung nur einmal nutzen.

mainBoard.name: Verduran Enchantress
mainBoard.originalText: While Enchantress is in play, you may immediately draw a card from your library each time you cast an enchantment.
mainBoard.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

mainBoard.name: Web
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures, though it does not gain flying ability.
mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

mainBoard.name: Whirling Dervish
mainBoard.originalText:
Protection from black
Gains +1/+1 (use counters) at the end of each turn in which it does damage to opponent.

rulings.text: If Dunerider Outlaw dealt damage to an opponent who later left the game before that turn's end step, its ability still gives it a +1/+1 counter.

Whirling Dervish's triggered ability checks to see if it dealt damage during the turn to an opponent of its current controller. If it dealt damage to player A, then player A takes control of it, the ability doesn't trigger.
Whirling Dervish's triggered ability gives it at most one +1/+1 counter each turn, regardless of how many opponents were dealt damage beyond the first.

mainBoard.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if this creature dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
